page.title: 06FENTON-LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There used to be a stone arch near the duck pond over the road. It was taken to Stubton Hall School. Mrs Bagworth, whose house was a bakery, told us that the bread was taken to Baggaley's house. She could also remember every one had a cow that was kept in a field by Gypsy Wood. Mrs Henson told us about the church. The church was built mostly in the 13th to the 14th century. It hasn't any stained glass windows which is strange for that time. The Lucas family are all buried in the churchyard. Some pews are called Poppyheads. John Daubney fell through the floor right from the top of the spire. He was not injured and you can see his nail marks down the wall. The bells have not been used for at least ten years.
